chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
x: nat

Goal:
nat_sorted (x :: nil)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
nat_sorted = fun ll : list nat => forall (l : list nat) (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), ll = l ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b : list nat -> Prop Arguments nat_sorted _%list_scope
ltl_unit : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x (b :: nil)
desc_end : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) /\ Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A leA a b
Relation_Operators.d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)
Relation_Operators.d_one : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil)
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
desc_prefix : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA x
desc_tail : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (b :: x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A leA a b
rev_unit : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), rev (l ++ a :: nil) = a :: rev l
removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), removelast (l ++ a :: nil) = l
repeat_to_concat : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A), repeat a n = concat (repeat (a :: nil) n)
last_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a d : A), last (l ++ a :: nil) d = a
last_length : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), length (l ++ a :: nil) = S (length l)
Ascii.N_of_ascii = fun a : Ascii.ascii => let (a0, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7) := a in Ascii.N_of_digits (a0 :: a1 :: a2 :: a3 :: a4 :: a5 :: a6 :: a7 :: nil) : Ascii.ascii -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_ascii _%char_scope
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
flat_map_single : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (l : list X), flat_map (fun x : X => f x :: nil) l = map f l
ZMicromega.cnf_of_list = fun (T : Type) (tg : T) (l : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)) => fold_right (fun (x : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) (acc : list (list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * T))) => if ZMicromega.Zunsat x then acc else ((x, tg) :: nil) :: acc) (Tauto.cnf_tt (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) T) l : forall T : Type, T -> list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) -> list (list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * T)) Arguments ZMicromega.cnf_of_list {T}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
Permutation.Permutation_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Permutation.Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
in_nat_sorted_0 = fun l : list nat => match l as l0 return (forall (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), nil = l0 ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b) with | nil => fun (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat) (H : nil = nil ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) => let H0 : False := eq_ind nil (fun e : list nat => match e with | nil => True | _ :: _ => False end) I (nil ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) H in False_ind (a < b) H0 | n :: l0 => fun (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat) (H : nil = (n :: l0) ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) => let H0 : False := eq_ind nil (fun e : list nat => match e with | nil => True | _ :: _ => False end) I ((n :: l0)...
Exists_cons_hd : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Exists P (x :: l)
Permutation.perm_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l
Exists_cons_tl : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), Exists P l -> Exists P (x :: l)
Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Exists P (x :: l) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (x : A) (l : list A), Exists P l -> Exists P (x :: l) Arguments Exists [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Exists_cons_hd [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Exists_cons_tl [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
Permutation.Permutation_cons_append : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x : A), x :: l ~p l ++ x :: nil
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
nil_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), nil <> x :: l
Permutation.Permutation_nil_cons : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x : A), ~ nil ~p x :: l
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), nil <> x ++ a :: y
Permutation.Permutation_nil_app_cons : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (x : A), ~ nil ~p l ++ x :: l'
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
NoDup_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
NoDup_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
Inductive NoDup (A : Type) : list A -> Prop := NoDup_nil : NoDup nil | NoDup_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l) Arguments NoDup [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments NoDup_nil _%type_scope Arguments NoDup_cons [A]%type_scope _ [l]%list_scope
Relation_Operators.Lt_nil : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x)
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
